msContents.summary: A palm leaf manuscript of Kalyāṇamalla's Anaṅgaraṅga, a 15th- or 16th-century erotic treatise composed for the Muslim aristocrat Lāḍakhāna, son of Ahmad of the Lodī dynasty.

filiation.p: The text transmitted by this manuscript closely resembles that in manuscript No 1801 of the India Office (IO) as recorded in Schmidt's edition of the Anaṅgaraṅga: e.g., see the readings of stanzas 1.1 and 1.3 (Schmidt 1927, Notes, p.1).

msItem.incipit:
datvā lākṣāṃ nakhāgre tadanu suradhunīdhautahastāgrabhājaṃ bhaktvā phālasthalāgrāt tadanu nayanayoḥ kajjalaṃ sanniveśya || kaṇṭhe
saṃprokṣya nīle tadanu ca vijayādattam ādarśam aṃge śaṃbhor bhasmānulipteḥ pulakitamṛśatī pārvatī naḥ punātu || 1 || atilaḻilitavilāsaṃ viśvacetoni
vāsaṃ samarakṛtavikāsaṃ śaṃbarākhyapraṇāśaṃ || ratinayanavirāmaṃ santatañ cābhirāmaṃ prasavabhavijitavāmaṃ śarmmadan naumi kāmaṃ || 2 ||
lodīvaṃśāvataṃso hataripuvanitānetravāriprapūraprādur bhutāṃburāśiś śamitaparayaśoā līlasaṃplāvitaś ca || tatputraḥ
khyātakīrtter aham madanṛpateḥ kāmasiddhāntavidyvān jīyyāchrīlāḍhahānaḥ kṣitipatimakuṭair ghṛṣṭapādāravindaḥ || 3 ||
msItem.explicit:
ditaparamārtthaḥ kāmaśāstrasya vidvān vividharativilolenodaiḥ kāminīnāṃ manāṃsi || anudinam anurāgāñjayelīlaṃ phalam avikala prā
pnuyāj janmanas saḥ || 58 || yāvach chaṃkaramaulikā suranadī gaurī tadarddhāṃgajugā yāvat premavatī payodhitāyā vaikuṇṭhanādhe harau || tāvat
kaḻāvidagdhamanasāṃ toṣāya bhūṣāyitaḥ prauḍhānaṃgabhujaṃgamasya bhavatāt grandhaḥ kilāyaṃ satāṃ || 59 || trailokyamohanaṃ ki
kuraṃgakhurasannibhaṃ || kāmināṃ kāmadaṃ loke vande mandanamandiraṃ || 60 || ❈ iti lodivaṃśāvataṃsamallahānavino
śrīkavikalyāṇamallaviracite anaṃgaraṃge vividhasaṃbhoganirūpaṇaṃ nāma daśamaṃ sthalaṃ || ❈

extent.measure: 1 cover folio, 1 guard folio, 1-13, 15-30, 1 guard folio.

collation.desc: Outer face: different shelfmarks, title and name of the author (written in devanāgarī script), all written with modern pens in different colours. Inner face: blank.

The invocations on both sides of the guard folio are so carelessly written to seem almost just a writing test. For the stanza written on the verso of the guard folio, see Mahāsubhāṣitasaṃgraha 4271 (Sternbach 1977, p. 1046-1047).
Folios 1 to 30, duly ordered; folio 14 is missing.
Inner face: blank. Outer face: shelfmarks written on small pieces of paper glued onto the cover.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript transmits the whole text, but folio 14 is missing and the last seven folios (folio 24 onwards) are broken on one or both ends, and part of the text is lost. On most of the folios some syllables are lost because of the tunnels bored by insects.

handNote.desc: Inked corrections are written on the margins; uninked corrections are written on the margins, interlinear or overwritten to the previous readings.

itthaṃ bharttari re samastayuvatiślākhyapidaivādasau madbhāgyena vivahitaḥ patir iti syān naikadoṣo yadi ||

binding.p: The covers are made from thicker palm leaves. All folios have 2 stringholes, the covers have 1 stringhole.
